default: (a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Psionics
entries: You channel the power of your thoughts and will to shape reality, bending the world around you through sheer mental force. Beginning at 1st level, this psionic power allows you to manifest spells. See the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB|10} for the rules of Spellcasting, and the Mystic spell list at the end of this class.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Mystic spell list. You learn additional Mystic cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Mystic Table. Whenever you gain a Mystic level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another Mystic cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Mystic table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Prepared of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You prepare two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Mystic spell list. The Spells Prepared column of the Mystic table shows when you prepare more Mystic spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can prepare one new spell of 1st or 2nd level. If you learn a spell from another feature of this class, it doesn't count against your number of cantrips and prepared spells.

If another Mystic feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Mystic spells for you.
Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Mystic spells for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Mystic Spells. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Mystic Spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: Your mind is the spellcasting focus for your Mystic spells. You can cast any spell on your Mystic spell list without requiring verbal or somatic components. You must have a free hand to cast spells that require somatic or material components, and you must still provide any material components that are consumed or have a required gold cost.

entries.name: Manifesting Psionics
entries: When you manifest a 1st level or higher spell with your psionics, it triggers unique and eerie changes in your presence. Perhaps your hair floats as if caught in an invisible wind, or a faint aura of crackling energy surrounds your body. You might cast spells that cause nearby objects to lightly tremble or float, or your shadow could split into multiple outlines that mimic your movements independently. Creatures around you are unmistakably aware when you use your psionics unless a feature specifies otherwise.

classFeature.name: Psychic Focus
entries: Starting at 1st level, your disciplined mind allows you to channel psychic energy into focused effects. This energy is represented by a Psychic Focus die, which starts as a {@dice d6} and increases in size as you gain levels in this class.
You can spend your Psychic Focus die in the following ways:

items: If you fail an Intelligence or Wisdom check, or a Constitution saving throw to maintain Concentration, you can roll your Psychic Focus die and add the result to your roll, potentially turning the failure into a success.

When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to create a shield of telekinetic energy. Roll your Psychic Focus die and reduce the damage taken by the result + your Mystic level.

entries: You can use your Psychic Focus a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
In addition, you can expend a Mystic spell slot (no action required) to regain one expended use of Psychic Focus.
The size of your Psychic Focus die increases at certain Mystic levels, becoming a {@dice d8} at 5th level, a {@dice d10} at 10th level, and a {@dice d12} at 15th level.

classFeature.name: Telekinesis
entries: As a Bonus Action you can manipulate or move one object within 60 feet of you. The object can't weigh more than a number of pounds equal to 10 times your Mystic level, and you can't affect an object being worn or carried by an unwilling creature. If the object is loose, you can move it up to 60 feet in any direction.
The object falls to the ground at the end of your next turn if you leave it suspended in midair, unless you take the Bonus Action to keep it floating.

classFeature.name: Telepathy
entries: Also from 2nd level, you can telepathically communicate with any creature within a number of feet of you equal to 30 times your Mystic level. You don't need to share a language for a creature to understand you, but it must speak at least one language or be telepathic itself to respond.

classFeature.name: Mystic Order
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a Mystic Order from the list of available orders (The Awakened, The Empathic, The Immortal, or The Phantom Blade). Each order specializes in a specific approach to psionics.
Your order gives you features when you choose it at 3rd level and additional features at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement (Mystic)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement (Mystic)
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement (Mystic)
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement (Mystic)
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement (Mystic)
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Psychic Recovery
entries: Starting at 5th level, you now also regain all your expended uses of Psychic Focus when you finish a Short Rest.

classFeature.name: Unbreakable Mind
entries: At 5th level, your mind becomes a stronghold against mental attacks. You gain Proficiency in Charisma saving throws and Resistance to Psychic damage.

classFeature.name: Mystic Order Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Mystic Order.

classFeature.name: Potent Psionics
entries: Starting at 7th level, your mystic energy surges against your foes. You gain one of the following options of your choice.

entries.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: You can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage you deal with any Mystic cantrip.

entries.name: Psionic Strikes
entries: Once per turn, when you deal damage to a creature with a weapon attack or an unarmed strike, you can deal extra Psychic damage to that creature equal to a roll of your Psychic Focus die (this roll does not expend the die).

classFeature.name: Clear Mind
entries: At 9th level, your stillness of mind and spirit grants you protection from mental intrusions. You can't be {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Frightened}, or possessed.

classFeature.name: Mystic Order Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Mystic Order.

classFeature.name: Unleashed Mind
entries: Starting at 11th level, your mastery over psionics allows you to transcend the limitations of ordinary spellcasters. When you finish a Long Rest, choose one spell from the Mystic spell list of a level that you can cast.

Until you choose a different spell with this feature, you always have the chosen spell prepared, and when you cast it, you don't need to manifest your psionics. You can also cast that spell at its lowest level without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) per Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Mystic Order Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Mystic Order.

classFeature.name: Superior Focus
entries: When you roll Initiative, you regain expended uses of Psychic Focus until you have two if you have fewer than that.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. Boon of Truesight is recommended.

classFeature.name: Ultimate Mind
entries: At 20th level, your mind surpasses mortal limits. Your Intelligence score increases by 4. Your maximum for that score is now 25.
You are also immune to any effect that would sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or determine you are lying unless you allow it.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Order: The Immortal
entries: An Immortal is a mystic who has transcended the limitations of their physical body through sheer mental power and psionic mastery. By channeling psionic energy into their body, they have unlocked unparalleled regenerative abilities, enhancing their unarmed combat to a divine level. Their pursuit of immortality is not just about eternal life, but achieving a state of perfect harmony between mind, body, and spirit.

These mystics are often seen as living embodiments of ancient wisdom, with bodies that resist the ravages of time and injuries that would fell lesser beings. They are warriors, monks, and sages all in one, who believe that true enlightenment comes from within.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Body
entries: When you choose this order at 3rd level, your psionic power enhances your physical form, granting you exceptional durability and unarmed combat prowess.

entries.name: Enhanced Defense
entries: When you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: At the start of each of your turns while you have half of your hit points or fewer, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 Hit Points.

entries.name: Unarmed Strikes
entries: You can use Intelligence instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes, which now deal damage equal to a roll of your Psychic Focus Die (this roll doesn't expend the die).

subclassFeature.name: Unseen Blow
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your merging of mind and body allows you to combine offense and defense. Whenever you use your Protective Field option of your {@classFeature Psychic Focus|Mystic|MRV1|1}, you can make one Unarmed Strike as part of the same Reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Mind and Fist
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you use your action to cast a Mystic spell, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.
Additionally, your Unarmed Strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance to nonmagical damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fullness of Body
entries: At 10th level, your psionic powers cause your body to unchain from mortal limits, granting you the following benefits:

items: You are Immune to Poison damage and to the {@condition Poisoned} condition.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
Whenever you finish a Short Rest, your {@condition Exhaustion} level, if any, is decreased by 1.

entries: Additionally, while your Immortal Nature is active, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, it takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

subclassFeature.name: Immortal Will
entries: At 14th level, you develop a remarkable healing factor. You stop aging, and you cannot be aged magically. Additionally, you regain Temporary Hit Points from your Immortal Nature feature also when you are not at or below half your hit points, and the Temporary Hit Points increase to twice your Intelligence modifier.

spell.name: Blind Spot
entries: You try to momentarily erase your image from the mind of one creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Intelligence saving throw, or you are {@condition Invisible} to it until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Psychic Crash
entries: You hurl a wave of psychic energy against a target that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage, and you can move it up to 10 feet in a straight line in a direction of your choice if it's Large or smaller. You can't lift the target off the ground unless it is already airborne or submerged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell creates two waves at level 5, three waves at level 11, and four waves at level 17. You can direct the waves at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each wave.

spell.name: Gembeam

m.text: a gem worth at least 100 gp

entries: A beam of otherworldly energy surges from you in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Choose Force, Necrotic, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder. Each creature in the line makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

If you roll the same number on two or more of the d6s, you can roll another d6, and add it to the damage. When you cast this spell, the maximum number of these d6s you can add to the spell's damage equals the spell's level + 1.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ghostly Gaze
entries: You gain the ability to see through solid objects within a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have darkvision if you don't already have it. For the duration, you perceive objects in that range as ghostly, transparent images, and you can see through them as though they were not there. This vision is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Psionic Investigation
entries: You focus your mind on an object you are holding, reading the psionic imprint left on it. For the duration, you gain the following insights:

items: Imprint Reading: You receive a mental image from the object's point of view, revealing the last creature to hold it within the past 24 hours.

Echoes of the Past: You perceive events that occurred within 20 feet of the object within the past hour. These events unfold from the object's perspective, allowing you to see and hear them as if you were present, though you cannot use other senses.

Psionic Sensor: As part of casting this spell, you can embed an intangible psionic sensor within the object. For the spell's duration, you can use an action to learn the object's location relative to you (its distance and direction) and to perceive its surroundings from its point of view as if you were there. This perception lasts until the start of your next turn. Once the spell ends, the psionic sensor dissipates.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.
